de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.geometry.edges

Class Parabola

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.geometry.edges.Parabola

  • public class Parabola
extends java.lang.Object
    A parabola is a two-dimensional, mirror-symmetrical curve, which is approximately U-shaped.
    One description of a parabola involves a point (the focus) and a line (the directrix). The focus does not lie on the directrix. The parabola is the set of points in that plane that are equidistant from both the directrix and the focus.
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Parabola

      • getVertex

        public Vector2D getVertex()
        Gets the vertex.

        The line perpendicular to the directrix and passing through the focus (that is, the line that splits the parabola through the middle) is called the "axis of symmetry". The point on the parabola that intersects the axis of symmetry is called the "vertex", and is the point where the parabola is most sharply curved.
        Returns:
        The vertex of this parabola.
